## Description {#details}

Run instruction simplification across each instruction in the function.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> simplification has useful constraints in some contexts:
<ul>
<li>It will never introduce <em>new</em> instructions.</li>
<li>There is no need to iterate to a fixed point.</li>
</ul>


Many passes use instruction simplification as a library facility, but it may also be useful (in tests and other contexts) to have access to this very restricted transform at a pass granularity. However, for a much more powerful and comprehensive peephole optimization engine, see the <code>instcombine</code> pass instead.

Definition at line 32 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/scalar/instsimplifypass-h">InstSimplifyPass.h</a>.
